title: DON'T MERGE: DEMO: decorator styles
body:
Here is a single file demo script. Just import it.

Note, that the entire point is not how to generally use `wrapt.decorator`, but the function `my_wraps_replacement`, which is a decorator supposed to replace `functools.wraps`. Therefore the only difference between `my_functools_decorator` and `my_wrapt_decorator` is the replacement of `@wraps(func)` by `@my_wraps_replacement(func)`. The goal is to not have to rewrite our decorators.

If you don't want to have a closer look, this is the important part of the output:

difference on simple decorated functions: we got the correct signature
```
old function:
ArgSpec(args=[], varargs='args', keywords='kwargs', defaults=None)
new function:
ArgSpec(args=['one', 'two', 'three'], varargs=None, keywords=None, defaults=(None,))
```

A decorated `__call__` method of a class, used with `@datasetmethod` (including adaption).
We got the correct signature for `__call__` as well as for `Dataset.command`:

```
full-scale additional decorator:
full-scale __call__ method:
ArgSpec(args=['what', 'dataset', 'ever'], varargs=None, keywords=None, defaults=(None, None))
wrapped with wrapt
actual __call__ method:
dataset: None
what: this
ever: ever
full-scale Dataset method:
ArgSpec(args=['what', 'dataset', 'ever'], varargs=None, keywords=None, defaults=(None, None))
wrapped with wrapt
actual __call__ method:
dataset: <Dataset path=/does/not/matter>
what: this
ever: ever
```

If you have any suggestions what else to test/verify or sth like that - let me now, @mih , @yarikoptic
